page.title: 17Escrick Estate today.
page.content: By the 20th Century,Escrick Estate had facilities such as a gas house, reservoir,generator,and the land owner could even stop and catch the mainline train which passed through his land. Early in the 1940's,Escrick Hall was considered too large for the family.It was divided into flats,then in 1948 it was leased,for use by Queen Margaret's School,to the Woodard Council who finally bought it 10 years ago. The Estate now owns 80 houses in Escrick, 50 on the Estate,all identifiable by their blue paintwork.The Estate employs a forester,three woodmen,a gardener,a gamekeeper,two office workers and ten farm workers. Mr. Forbes-Adam now owns 7,000 acres,of which 700 are woodland.It is interesting to note that whereas once 60% of the remaining land was grassland,now almost 100% is farmland.
